subNodes.conversationText: root
"You're back! Is it done? Is Azzerakin dead?"
"No, not yet. I just had some questions."
"What can I help you with?"
"You're working with Azzerakin. Why shouldn't I just kill you?"
His eyes widen and he speaks quickly. "Please don't. Don't do that. I can  help you, I swear it. I'm no use to you dead!"
"What help can you be?"
"I know things!" He gestures around uncertainly.
"I'll think about it. There's something else."
"What else I can help you with?"
"What do you know about Elderin Stones?"
"Lots! They're my speciality. Is that why you're here?"
"Yes. Where can I find one?"

"Azzerakin has one. She's trying to use it now. But she doesn't know how."

Dalamar grins. "I know how. But I won't tell her. She's completely mad."
"Will you tell me?"
"Get rid of Azzerakin and bring me the stone. I'll explain to you how it works, if you let me live."
"I'll think about it. There's something else."
"What else I can help you with?"
"Do you know what lies beneath the temple?"

Dalamar blinks.

"There's something beneath the temple?"
"So I hear."

"I honestly have no idea. I've explored all the areas of the temple, and I haven't found any sign of anything below the Lower Crypt."

He pauses and reflects. "Having said that, there are a couple of doors I haven't been able to open. One of them might lead down. Its possible, I guess."
"I have other questions."
"What else I can help you with?"
"Why are you working for Azzerakin?"

"I'm not. I came here to study the Elderin. And... alright, I'll admit it. I was hoping to find some of their lost treasures. Azzerakin was here when I arrived and, well, I'm basically keeping out of her way. I can't stand the woman and her creations scare the hell out of me."
"I have other questions."
"What else I can help you with?"
"That's all for now."
"Listen to me. Go and deal with Azzerakin. Bring me the Elderin Stone and I'll show you how to use it, I promise."
"You're a bit too keen, you know that?"
"I'll be back."
"No, not yet. I'll leave you to it."

The man before you is thin and nervous. His eyes widen when he sees you and he starts to sweat.

"My word! My word! I... well, I just. I mean, I'm Dalamar. I have no idea how you got down here, but you are most welcome. Most welcome!"

He sticks out his hand. There is something slightly... inhuman about his jerky movement, and his eyes shine with a strange light.
[Shake his hand] "I am <FullName>."

"Well, nice to meet you. Or nice to eat you, you as the crocorux says!"

His eyes dart nervously. 

"No forget that. Sorry, sorry! I'm not going to eat you. No no no no no. I didn't mean it that way."
"You're waffling. Where is Azzerakin?"

Dalamar jumps slightly when you say her name.

"Down in the Lower Crypts. She's fiddling with something. I mean, studying." He laughs. "Fiddling, studying. Who knows what she's really up to. She never tells me anything."
"What is studying?"
Dalamar shudders. "Those ghastly blood pools. She created them to practice her dark arts on creating blood fiends."
"Fine."
"What else I can help you with?"
"You're working with Azzerakin. Why shouldn't I just kill you?"
His eyes widen and he speaks quickly. "Please don't. Don't do that. I can  help you, I swear it. I'm no use to you dead!"
"What help can you be?"
"I know things!" He gestures around uncertainly.
"I'll think about it. There's something else."
"What else I can help you with?"
"What do you know about Elderin Stones?"
"Lots! They're my speciality. Is that why you're here?"
"Yes. Where can I find one?"

"Azzerakin has one. She's trying to use it now. But she doesn't know how."

Dalamar grins. "I know how. But I won't tell her. She's completely mad."
"Will you tell me?"
"Get rid of Azzerakin and bring me her stone. I'll explain to you how it works, if you let me live."
"I'll think about it. There's something else."
"What else I can help you with?"
"Do you know what lies beneath the temple?"

Dalamar blinks.

"There's something beneath the temple?"
"So I hear."

"I honestly have no idea. I've explored all the areas of the temple, and I haven't found any sign of anything below the Lower Crypt."

He pauses and reflects. "Having said that, there are a couple of doors I haven't been able to open. One of them might lead down. Its possible, I guess."
"I have other questions."
"What else I can help you with?"
"Why are you working for Azzerakin?"

"I'm not. I came here to study the Elderin. And... alright, I'll admit it. I was hoping to find some of their lost treasures. Azzerakin was here when I arrived and, well, I'm basically keeping out of her way. I can't stand the woman and her creations scare the hell out of me."
"I have other questions."
"What else I can help you with?"
"That's all for now."
"Listen to me. Take this key, and go and deal with Azzerakin. Bring me the Elderin Stone and I'll show you how to use it, I promise."
"You're a bit too keen, you know that?"
"I'll be back."
